body: What's your command/config

I tried with Waifu2x Caffe and Waifu 2x Converter CPP
Also, NCNN Vulkan gives the same result but gives a green tint

What I mean is your FFmpeg output codec, the default should be libx264, which should create H.264 MP4 files.

Check the metadata of your output video and see what it says.

W2X NCNN Vulkan has a bug right now: https://github.com/nihui/waifu2x-ncnn-vulkan/issues/59
I'll revert the version in the release later.
Also, which release of Video2X are you using?
The metadata doesn't show up in the file properties and I am using the 4.1.0 version

It's not in properties. You can view it in VLC but that might be annoying.
I've added a little tool in 4.1.0, go to Tools tab and drag the video into FFprobe window.
Paste the output or screenshot here.


Looks completely fine
I can still convert it using Premiere Pro but that takes too much time

Ok I have a guess here. Try changing the pixel format from `yuv444p10le` to `yuv420p`

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/82154687-06b40e80-985f-11ea-81a7-b142f1d9fb59.png)
That worked, thanks! Is there a way to safe the settings though? I can't find a save button anywhere

GUI loads settings from the YAML file.
You can edit the default settings in the configuration files.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21986859/82155306-8643dc80-9863-11ea-9e71-ceeac4e1cb5c.png)
Maybe I'll consider shipping `yuv420p` as the default pixel format for better compatibility?
Now I experience a bug where bulk upscaling gives me an error at 99% of the first file, upscaling them one-by-one doesn't give any error though
Could you please show me what error it is?
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/50540735/82155693-193a4200-9877-11ea-83a3-b7f65727d4cd.png)
"When reporting an error, please include console output."
Please take a screenshot of the console output

The output is incomplete, but it appears you're using multiple instances of waifu2x-caffe?
The upscale seems to be running and died half way, which may be caused by one of the threads terminated due to the lack of available VRAM.
If you're using waifu2x, don't use multiple processes.
I only had one instance of Waifu2x open and one tab of Chrome open

All that I can see from the error message is that waifu2x ran into an error half-way and died.
What setup do you have, specifically, what GPU are you using?
A GeForce 1050ti

You might have ran out of VRAM.
Try waifu2x-converter-cpp, it should consume less VRAM and still give you similar results with its cunet model.
I'm trying to guess why it can convert files one-by-one just fine but can't do the same thing when importing a folder
I think I found the issue, there were two files that were 80 - 100mb big, that might have been the issue so I removed them and so far it's not giving any errors
do you mean an image file that's 80-100MB in size?
